pullRequest.body:
Also deprecate `Nat.bit_eq_zero`. It is identical to `Nat.bit_eq_zero_iff`.


---

PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,

- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

:v: FR-vdash-bot can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11420181827/job/31775582283)
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11420181827/job/31775582172)
I wonder if youcan drop `ne_eq` here and use `bit_ne_zero_iff`.
It doesn't work yet, `bit_ne_zero_iff` is not imported. It should be moved to a better file later.
I assume we already have a lemma saying `a,toNat = 0 ‚Üî !a` to replace this?
`simp?` says `simp only [bit_mod_two, Bool.toNat_eq_zero, Bool.not_eq_eq_eq_not, Bool.not_true]`. `!a` is actually `!a = true`. Both sides will be simplified to `a = false` now.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore(Data/Nat/{Bit, Bitwise}): make `Nat.bit_mod_two` `Nat.bit_eq_zero_iff` be `simp`
